qas.question: What tribes inhibited the area that now constitutes Himachal Pradesh?

answers.text: Koilis, Halis, Dagis, Dhaugris, Dasa, Khasas, Kinnars, and Kirats

qas.question: What time periods did the Indus Valley civilization flourish?
When did Mahmud Ghanznavi conquer Kangara?
Who marched through the lower states and captured and forts and fought many battles?
During what period did Dagis exist, and then become conquered by the Gupta Empire?

plausible_answers.text: the Koilis, Halis, Dagis, Dhaugris, Dasa, Khasas, Kinnars, and Kirats

qas.question: What tribes lived in the area that is now Janapada?
During what time period did King Harshavardhana rule?
Who conqurered the Indus valley in 1750 BCE?
Who did the Dhali Sultanate pay tribute to?

context: The history of the area that now constitutes Himachal Pradesh dates back to the time when the Indus valley civilisation flourished <a1_0><b7_0>between 2250 and 1750 BCE<b7_0/><a1_0/>. Tribes such as <b6_0>the <a0_0>Koilis, Halis, Dagis, Dhaugris, Dasa, Khasas, Kinnars, and Kirats<b6_0/><a0_0/> inhabited the region from the prehistoric era. <b5_0>During the Vedic period<b5_0/>, several small republics known as "Janapada" existed which were later conquered by the Gupta Empire. After a brief period of supremacy by King Harshavardhana, the region was once again divided into several local powers headed by chieftains, including some Rajput principalities. These kingdoms enjoyed a large degree of independence and were invaded by Delhi Sultanate a number of times. <a2_0><b8_0>Mahmud Ghaznavi<b8_0/><a2_0/> conquered Kangra at the beginning of the <a3_0>10th century<a3_0/>. <a4_0>Timur and Sikander Lodi<a4_0/> also marched through the lower hills of the state and captured a number of forts and fought many battles. Several hill states acknowledged Mughal suzerainty and paid regular tribute to <b9_0>the Mughals<b9_0/>.
